dexEntry: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
name: Bulbasaur

dexEntry: To support its bulb, Ivysaur's legs grow sturdy. If it spends more time lying in the sunlight, the bud will soon bloom into a large flower.
name: Ivysaur

dexEntry: Venusaur's flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.
name: Venusaur

dexEntry: Venusaur's flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.
name: Venusaur

dexEntry: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is happy, and blazes when it is enraged.
name: Charmander

dexEntry: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
name: Charmeleon

dexEntry: A Charizard flies about in search of strong opponents. It breathes intense flames that can melt any material. However, it will never torch a weaker foe.
name: Charizard

dexEntry: A Charizard flies about in search of strong opponents. It breathes intense flames that can melt any material. However, it will never torch a weaker foe.
name: Charizard

dexEntry: A Charizard flies about in search of strong opponents. It breathes intense flames that can melt any material. However, it will never torch a weaker foe.
name: Charizard

dexEntry: Its shell is not just for protection. Its rounded shape and the grooves on its surface minimize resistance in water, enabling Squirtle to swim at high speeds.
name: Squirtle

dexEntry: Its large tail is covered with rich, thick fur that deepens in color with age. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon's toughness in battle.
name: Wartortle

dexEntry: The waterspouts that protrude from its shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of water can precisely nail tin cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
name: Blastoise

dexEntry: The waterspouts that protrude from its shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of water can precisely nail tin cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
name: Blastoise

dexEntry: Its voracious appetite compels it to devour leaves bigger than itself without hesitation. It releases a terribly strong odor from its antennae.
name: Caterpie

dexEntry: Its shell is as hard as an iron slab. A Metapod does not move very much because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the shell.
name: Metapod

dexEntry: It has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can seek, extract, and carry honey from flowers blooming over six miles away.
name: Butterfree

dexEntry: A Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It distinguishes its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
name: Weedle

dexEntry: It remains virtually immobile while it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it busily prepares for evolution. This is evident from how hot its shell becomes.
name: Kakuna

dexEntry: A Beedrill is extremely territorial. For safety reasons, no one should ever approach its nest. If angered, they will attack in a swarm.
name: Beedrill

dexEntry: A Beedrill is extremely territorial. For safety reasons, no one should ever approach its nest. If angered, they will attack in a swarm.
name: Beedrill

dexEntry: It has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It can unerringly return home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
name: Pidgey

dexEntry: This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its large territory. If its living space is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
name: Pidgeotto

dexEntry: This Pokémon has gorgeous, glossy feathers. Many trainers are so captivated by the beautiful feathers on its head that they choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
name: Pidgeot

dexEntry: This Pokémon has gorgeous, glossy feathers. Many trainers are so captivated by the beautiful feathers on its head that they choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
name: Pidgeot

dexEntry: A Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly moves its ears and listens for danger. It will make its nest anywhere.
name: Rattata

dexEntry: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people's homes. Then it steals whatever food it finds.
name: Rattata

dexEntry: A Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
name: Raticate

dexEntry: It forms a group of Rattata, which it assumes command of. Each group has its own territory, and disputes over food happen often.
name: Raticate

dexEntry: Its loud cry can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
name: Spearow

dexEntry: Its long neck and elongated beak are ideal for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves this extended and skinny beak to pluck prey.
name: Fearow

dexEntry: An Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. This position allows it to quickly respond to an enemy from any direction with a threat from its upraised head.
name: Ekans

dexEntry: This Pokémon has a terrifically strong constricting power. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once it wraps its body around its foe, escaping is impossible.
name: Arbok

dexEntry: It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks. When it releases pent-up energy in a burst, the electric power is equal to a lightning bolt.
name: Pikachu

dexEntry: If it stores too much electricity, its behavior turns aggressive. To avoid this, it occasionally discharges excess energy and calms itself down.
name: Raichu

dexEntry: It uses psychokinesis to control electricity. It hops aboard its own tail, using psychic powers to lift it and move about.
name: Raichu

dexEntry: When it curls up in a ball, it can make any attack bounce off harmlessly. Its hide has turned tough and solid as a result of living in the desert.
name: Sandshrew

dexEntry: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard--so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
name: Sandshrew

dexEntry: It curls up in a ball to protect itself from enemy attacks. It also curls up to prevent heatstroke during the daytime when temperatures rise sharply.
name: Sandslash

dexEntry: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.
name: Sandslash

dexEntry: Its highly toxic barbs are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
name: Nidoran

dexEntry: When it is with its friends or family, its barbs are tucked away to prevent injury. It appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
name: Nidorina

dexEntry: It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles using its tough, scaly body. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
name: Nidoqueen

dexEntry: The male Nidoran has developed muscles that freely move its ears in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon's notice.
name: Nidoran

dexEntry: Its horn is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
name: Nidorino

dexEntry: A Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power capable of toppling a metal transmission tower. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
name: Nidoking

dexEntry: On every night of a full moon, they come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy go to sleep nestled up against each other in deep and quiet mountains.
name: Clefairy

dexEntry: A Clefable uses its wings to skip lightly as if it were flying. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. On quiet, moonlit nights, it strolls on lakes.
name: Clefable

dexEntry: It can freely control fire, making fiery orbs fly like will-o'-the-wisps. Just before evolution, its six tails grow hot as if on fire.
name: Vulpix

dexEntry: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
name: Vulpix

dexEntry: It has long been said that each of the nine tails embody an enchanted power. A long-lived Ninetales will have fur that shines like gold.
name: Ninetales

dexEntry: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.
name: Ninetales

dexEntry: Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a Jigglypuff's song. The sound waves of its singing voice match the brain waves of someone in a deep sleep.
name: Jigglypuff

dexEntry: Its fur is the ultimate in luxuriousness. Sleeping alongside a Wigglytuff is simply divine. Its body expands seemingly without end when it inhales.
name: Wigglytuff

dexEntry: While living in pitch-black caverns, their eyes gradually grew shut and deprived them of vision. They use ultrasonic waves to detect obstacles.
name: Zubat

dexEntry: Its fangs easily puncture even thick animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood of people and Pokémon. It flits about in darkness and strikes from behind.
name: Golbat

dexEntry: This Pokémon grows by absorbing moonlight. During the daytime, it buries itself in the ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to avoid detection by its enemies.
name: Oddish

dexEntry: A horribly noxious honey drools from its mouth. One whiff of the honey can result in memory loss. Some fans are said to enjoy this overwhelming stink, however.
name: Gloom

dexEntry: In seasons when it produces more pollen, the air around a Vileplume turns yellow with the powder as it walks. The pollen is highly toxic and causes paralysis.
name: Vileplume

dexEntry: A Paras has parasitic tochukaso mushrooms growing on its back. They grow by drawing nutrients from the host. They are valued as a medicine for long life.
name: Paras

dexEntry: Parasect are known to infest the roots of large trees en masse and drain nutrients. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
name: Parasect

dexEntry: Its coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body is said to have evolved for protection. Its large eyes never fail to spot even miniscule prey.
name: Venonat

dexEntry: Venomoth are nocturnal--they only are active at night. Their favorite prey are insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
name: Venomoth

dexEntry: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple--wherever they burrow, the soil is left perfectly tilled for growing delicious crops.
name: Diglett

dexEntry: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
name: Diglett

dexEntry: Because the triplets originally split from one body, they think exactly alike. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly through the ground.
name: Dugtrio

dexEntry: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.
name: Dugtrio

dexEntry: Meowth withdraw their sharp claws into their paws to silently sneak about. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
name: Meowth

dexEntry: When its pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.
name: Meowth

dexEntry: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
name: Meowth

dexEntry: A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
name: Persian

dexEntry: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.
name: Persian

dexEntry: When its headache intensifies, it starts using strange powers. However, it has no recollection of its powers, so it always looks befuddled and bewildered.
name: Psyduck

dexEntry: A Golduck is an adept swimmer. It sometimes joins competitive swimmers in training. It uses psychic powers when its forehead shimmers with light.
name: Golduck

dexEntry: When it starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign of anger. However, since this happens instantly, there is no time to flee.

dexEntry: When it becomes furious, its blood circulation becomes more robust, and its muscles are made stronger. But it also becomes much less intelligent.
name: Primeape

dexEntry: Its superb sense of smell ensures that this Pokémon won't forget any scent, no matter what. It uses its sense of smell to detect the emotions of others.

dexEntry: This fleet-footed Pokémon is said to run over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within its body is its source of power.
name: Arcanine

dexEntry: It is possible to see this Pokémon's spiral innards right through its thin skin. However, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
name: Poliwag

dexEntry: Its body surface is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.

dexEntry: Its highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This Pokémon can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
name: Poliwrath

dexEntry: A Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day. Observation revealed that it uses Teleport to change its location once every hour.
name: Abra

dexEntry: It is rumored that a boy with psychic abilities suddenly transformed into Kadabra while he was assisting research into extrasensory powers.
name: Kadabra

dexEntry: While it has strong psychic abilities and high intelligence, an Alakazam's muscles are very weak. It uses psychic power to move its body.
name: Alakazam

dexEntry: While it has strong psychic abilities and high intelligence, an Alakazam's muscles are very weak. It uses psychic power to move its body.
name: Alakazam

dexEntry: It continually undertakes strenuous training to master all forms of martial arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.
name: Machop

dexEntry: A belt is worn by a Machoke to keep its overwhelming power under control. Because it is so dangerous, no one has ever removed the belt.
name: Machoke

dexEntry: It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
name: Machamp

dexEntry: A Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.
name: Bellsprout

dexEntry: At night, a Weepinbell hangs on to a tree branch with its hooked rear and sleeps. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
name: Weepinbell

dexEntry: The long vine extending from its head is waved about as if it were a living thing to attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim approaches, it is swallowed whole.
name: Victreebel

dexEntry: Its body is almost entirely composed of water. It ensnares its foe with its two long tentacles, then stabs with the poison stingers at their tips.

dexEntry: It lives in complex rock formations on the ocean floor and traps prey using its 80 tentacles. Its red orbs glow when it grows excited or agitated.

dexEntry: It climbs mountain paths using only the power of its arms. Because they look just like boulders lining paths, hikers may step on them without noticing.

dexEntry: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

dexEntry: They descend from mountains by tumbling down steep slopes. They are so brutal, they smash aside obstructing trees and massive boulders with thunderous tackles.
name: Graveler

dexEntry: Its preferred food is dravite. After it's eaten, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of its body.
name: Graveler

dexEntry: It is said to live in volcanic craters on mountain peaks. Once a year, it sheds its hide and grows larger. The shed hide crumbles and returns to the soil.

dexEntry: Because it can't fire boulders at a rapid pace, it's been known to seize nearby Geodude and fire them from its back.
name: Golem

dexEntry: A Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. Its legs become stronger as it stumbles and falls while trying to keep up with its parent.
name: Ponyta

dexEntry: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.
name: Ponyta

dexEntry: It usually canters casually in the fields and plains. But once a Rapidash turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
name: Rapidash

dexEntry: Brave and prideful, this Pokémon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.
name: Rapidash

dexEntry: It catches prey by dipping its tail in water at the side of a river. But it often forgets what it is doing and spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
name: Slowpoke

dexEntry: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.
name: Slowpoke

dexEntry: Its tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
name: Slowbro

dexEntry: Its tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
name: Slowbro

dexEntry: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.
name: Slowbro

dexEntry: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
name: Magnemite

dexEntry: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
name: Magneton

dexEntry: It is always seen with a stick from a plant. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This Pokémon occasionally fights with others over choice sticks.

dexEntry: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch'd that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.
name: Farfetch'd

dexEntry: Even while eating or sleeping, one of the heads remains always vigilant for any sign of danger. When threatened, it flees at over 60 miles per hour.
name: Doduo

dexEntry: A peculiar Pokémon species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
name: Dodrio

dexEntry: Seel hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

dexEntry: It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
name: Dewgong

dexEntry: Born from polluted sludge in the sea, Grimer's favorite food is anything filthy. They feed on wastewater pumped out from factories.
name: Grimer

dexEntry: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.
name: Grimer

dexEntry: It prefers warm and humid habitats. In the summertime, the toxic substances in its body intensify, making Muk reek like putrid kitchen garbage.
name: Muk

dexEntry: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.
name: Muk

dexEntry: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
name: Shellder

dexEntry: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The Cloyster shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
name: Cloyster

dexEntry: When exposed to a strong wind, a Gastly's gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
name: Gastly

dexEntry: If a Haunter beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don't approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
name: Haunter

dexEntry: Deep in the night, your shadow cast by a streetlight may suddenly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
name: Gengar

dexEntry: Deep in the night, your shadow cast by a streetlight may suddenly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
name: Gengar

dexEntry: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an Onix from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
name: Onix

dexEntry: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that a Drowzee is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
name: Drowzee

dexEntry: The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum in a Hypno's hand lull the foe into deep hypnosis. While searching for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
name: Hypno

dexEntry: Krabby live in holes dug into beaches. On sandy shores with little in the way of food, they can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
name: Krabby

dexEntry: It waves its huge, oversized claw in the air to communicate with others. But since the claw is so heavy, this Pokémon quickly tires.
name: Kingler

dexEntry: It bears an uncanny and unexplained resemblance to a Poké Ball. Because it explodes at the slightest shock, even veteran trainers treat it with caution.
name: Voltorb

dexEntry: They appear in great numbers at electric power plants. Because they feed on electricity, they cause massive and chaotic blackouts in nearby cities.
name: Electrode

dexEntry: It consists of six eggs that care for each other. The eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear, it is close to evolution.
name: Exeggcute

dexEntry: Originally from the tropics, Exeggutor's heads grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall, they group to form an Exeggcute.
name: Exeggutor

dexEntry: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, awakening the power of the sleeping dragon.
name: Exeggutor

dexEntry: It pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull it wears are from its tears.
name: Cubone

dexEntry: A Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has grown tough by overcoming the grief of losing its mother. Its tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
name: Marowak

dexEntry: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.
name: Marowak

dexEntry: Its legs freely stretch and contract. Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its tired legs.
name: Hitmonlee

dexEntry: A Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who aimed to become the world champion. Having an indomitable spirit means that it will never give up.
name: Hitmonchan

dexEntry: Whenever it sees something unfamiliar, it always licks the object because it memorizes things by texture and taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
name: Lickitung

dexEntry: Getting up close to a Koffing will give you a chance to observe, through its thin skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It blows up at the slightest stimulation.
name: Koffing

dexEntry: By diluting its toxic gases with a special process, the highest grade of perfume can be extracted. To Weezing, gases emanating from garbage are the ultimate feast.
name: Weezing

dexEntry: Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, Weezing changed into this form for some reason.
name: Weezing

dexEntry: Once it starts running, it doesn't stop. Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it can't remember why it started running in the first place.
name: Rhyhorn

dexEntry: Its horn, which rotates like a drill, destroys tall buildings with one strike. It stands on its hind legs, and its brain is well developed.
name: Rhydon

dexEntry: Chansey lay nutritionally excellent eggs every day. The eggs are so delicious, they are eagerly devoured by even those who have lost their appetite.
name: Chansey

dexEntry: Its vines snap off easily and painlessly if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by new growth the very next day.
name: Tangela

dexEntry: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, never try to catch it. The baby's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged.
name: Kangaskhan

dexEntry: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, never try to catch it. The baby's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged.
name: Kangaskhan

dexEntry: By cleverly flicking the fins on its back side to side, it moves in any direction while facing forward. It spits ink to escape if it senses danger.
name: Horsea

dexEntry: The poisonous barbs all over its body are highly valued as ingredients for making traditional herbal medicine. It shows no mercy to anything approaching its nest.
name: Seadra

dexEntry: In the springtime, schools of Goldeen can be seen swimming up falls and rivers. It metes out staggering damage with its single horn.
name: Goldeen

dexEntry: It punches holes in boulders on stream- beds. This is a clever innovation that prevents its eggs from being attacked or washed away by the current.
name: Seaking

dexEntry: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
name: Staryu

dexEntry: People in ancient times imagined that Starmie were transformed from the reflections of stars that twinkled on gentle waves at night.
name: Starmie

dexEntry: A Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. It can convince others that something unseeable actually exists. Once believed, the imaginary object does become real.
name: Mr. Mime

dexEntry: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It’ll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.
name: Mr. Mime

dexEntry: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes. The scythes can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
name: Scyther

dexEntry: A Jynx sashays rhythmically as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without noticing.
name: Jynx

dexEntry: When a storm approaches, it competes with others to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
name: Electabuzz

dexEntry: In battle, it blows out intense flames from all over its body to intimidate its foe. These fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in the area.
name: Magmar

dexEntry: Their pincers are strong enough to shatter thick logs. Because they dislike cold, Pinsir burrow and sleep under the ground on chilly nights.
name: Pinsir

dexEntry: Their pincers are strong enough to shatter thick logs. Because they dislike cold, Pinsir burrow and sleep under the ground on chilly nights.
name: Pinsir

dexEntry: It is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
name: Tauros

dexEntry: Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is easily washed away by currents. In places where water pools, you can see many Magikarp deposited there by the flow.
name: Magikarp

dexEntry: It is an extremely vicious and violent Pokémon. When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.
name: Gyarados

dexEntry: It is an extremely vicious and violent Pokémon. When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.
name: Gyarados

dexEntry: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, it is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
name: Lapras

dexEntry: A Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself. However, if it tries to change based on its memory, it will get details wrong.
name: Ditto

dexEntry: An Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to its environment. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokémon to evolve.
name: Eevee

dexEntry: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow them to live underwater. They have the ability to freely control water.
name: Vaporeon

dexEntry: Its cells generate weak power that is amplified by its fur's static electricity to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
name: Jolteon

dexEntry: Flareon's fluffy fur releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. Its body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.
name: Flareon

dexEntry: It is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data in order to enter cyberspace. A Porygon is copy- protected so it cannot be duplicated.
name: Porygon

dexEntry: One of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by humans. If attacked, it withdraws into its hard shell.
name: Omanyte

dexEntry: An Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large, making its movements slow and ponderous.
name: Omastar

dexEntry: It is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in rare cases, living examples have been discovered. Kabuto have not changed for 300 million years.
name: Kabuto

dexEntry: Kabutops once swam underwater to hunt for prey. It was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from changes in its gills and legs.
name: Kabutops

dexEntry: Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from DNA extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies.
name: Aerodactyl

dexEntry: Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from DNA extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies.
name: Aerodactyl

dexEntry: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.
name: Snorlax

dexEntry: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
name: Articuno

dexEntry: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. It gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
name: Zapdos

dexEntry: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control fire. If injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
name: Moltres

dexEntry: A Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
name: Dratini

dexEntry: A Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter the weather around it by loosing energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
name: Dragonair

dexEntry: It can circle the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
name: Dragonite

dexEntry: A Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans made its body, they failed to give it a warm heart.
name: Mewtwo

dexEntry: A Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans made its body, they failed to give it a warm heart.
name: Mewtwo

dexEntry: A Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans made its body, they failed to give it a warm heart.
name: Mewtwo

dexEntry: A Mew is said to possess the genes of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
name: Mew

dexEntry: It waves its leaf around to keep foes at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, creating a friendly atmosphere that becalms the battlers.
name: Chikorita

dexEntry: A Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each leaf is a small tree shoot. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
name: Bayleef

dexEntry: The fragrance of a Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, it gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
name: Meganium

dexEntry: It flares flames from its back to protect itself. The fire burns vigorously if the Pokémon is angry. When it is tired, it sputters with incomplete combustion.
name: Cyndaquil

dexEntry: It intimidates foes with intense gusts of flames and superheated air. Its quick nimbleness lets it dodge attacks even while scorching an enemy.
name: Quilava

dexEntry: It can hide behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intense flames. Typhlosion create blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
name: Typhlosion

dexEntry: Despite its small body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While it may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough strength to cause serious injury.
name: Totodile

dexEntry: Once its jaws clamp down on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like fishhooks, they become irremovably embedded.
name: Croconaw

dexEntry: It opens its huge mouth to intimidate enemies. In battle, it runs using its thick and powerful hind legs to charge the foe with incredible speed.
name: Feraligatr

dexEntry: They take turns standing guard when it is time to sleep. The sentry awakens the others if it senses danger. If one becomes separated, it turns sleepless with fear.
name: Sentret

dexEntry: A Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, it is very nimble and fleet.
name: Furret

dexEntry: It has an internal organ that senses the earth's rotation. Using this special organ, a Hoothoot begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
name: Hoothoot

dexEntry: It unfailingly catches prey in darkness. Noctowl owe their success to superior vision that allows them to see in minimal light, and to their supple and silent wings.
name: Noctowl

dexEntry: Ledyba communicate using a fluid that they secrete from where the legs join the body. They are said to convey feelings to others by altering the fluid's scent.
name: Ledyba

dexEntry: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live many Ledian. For good reason, they use the light of the stars as energy.
name: Ledian

dexEntry: The web it spins can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that a Spinarak determines its prey by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web.
name: Spinarak

dexEntry: Its feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. It constricts its foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
name: Ariados

dexEntry: Over the course of evolution, its hind legs turned into wings. By alternately resting its front and rear wings, it can fly all day without having to stop.
name: Crobat

dexEntry: When it senses danger, it discharges positive and negative electricity from its two antennae. It lives in depths beyond sunlight's reach.
name: Chinchou

dexEntry: The light-emitting orbs on its back are very bright. They are formed from a part of its dorsal fin. This Pokémon illuminates the inky darkness of deep seas.
name: Lanturn

dexEntry: It is still inept at retaining electricity. When it is startled, it discharges power accidentally. It gets better at holding power as it grows older.
name: Pichu

dexEntry: It is still inept at retaining electricity. When it is startled, it discharges power accidentally. It gets better at holding power as it grows older.
name: Pichu

dexEntry: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance until daybreak, when they quench their thirst with the morning dew.
name: Cleffa

dexEntry: Its soft and pliable body is very bouncy. When it sings continuously with all its might, its body steadily turns a deepening pink color.
name: Igglybuff

dexEntry: As its energy, it uses the feelings of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. It stores up happy feelings in its shell, then shares them out.
name: Togepi

dexEntry: It is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When it spots someone who is pure of heart, a Togetic appears and shares its happiness with that person.
name: Togetic

dexEntry: It runs up short trees that grow on the savanna to peck at new shoots. A Natu's eyes look as if they are always observing something.
name: Natu

dexEntry: It has the enigmatic power of foreseeing the future. Some people in different lands have long believed that Xatu are emissaries from another world.
name: Xatu

dexEntry: Its fluffy wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more energy is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
name: Mareep

dexEntry: Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
name: Flaaffy

dexEntry: It gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used its light to send signals back and forth with others far away.
name: Ampharos

dexEntry: It gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used its light to send signals back and forth with others far away.
name: Ampharos

dexEntry: Its flower petals deepen in color through exposure to sunlight. When cloudy weather persists, it does a dance that is thought to be a ritual for summoning the sun.
name: Bellossom

dexEntry: Its body is covered with water-repellent fur. Because of the fur, it can swim through water at high speed without being slowed by the water's resistance.
name: Marill

dexEntry: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.
name: Azumarill

dexEntry: It mimics a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. But since its forelegs remain green throughout the year, it is easily identified as a fake in the winter.
name: Sudowoodo

dexEntry: The curled hair on its head proves its status as a king. It is said that the longer and curlier the hair, the more respect it earns from its peers.
name: Politoed

dexEntry: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, a Hoppip links leaves with others to prepare against being blown away.
name: Hoppip

dexEntry: It blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees F. Because its flower's blooming changes with the temperature, it is sometimes used as a thermometer.
name: Skiploom

dexEntry: Jumpluff ride warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. This Pokémon lands when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
name: Jumpluff

dexEntry: Its tail ends with a dexterous, handlike appendage. However, because it uses the tail so much, Aipom's real hands have become rather clumsy.
name: Aipom

dexEntry: Sunkern try to minimize movement to conserve the nutrients they have stored in their bodies for evolution. They will not eat, subsisting only on morning dew.
name: Sunkern

dexEntry: Sunflora convert solar energy into nutrition. They are highly active in the warm daytime but suddenly stop moving as soon as the sun sets.
name: Sunflora

dexEntry: It can see 360 degrees without moving its eyes. It is a great flier capable of making sudden stops and turning midair to quickly chase down targeted prey.
name: Yanma

dexEntry: Wooper usually live in water but come out onto land seeking food occasionally. On land, they coat their bodies with a gooey, toxic film.
name: Wooper

dexEntry: A Quagsire hunts by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in. Because it doesn't move, it does not get very hungry.
name: Quagsire

dexEntry: An Espeon is extremely loyal to any trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said to have developed precognitive powers to protect its trainer from harm.
name: Espeon

dexEntry: Umbreon evolved from exposure to the moon's energy pulses. It lurks in darkness and waits for its foes to move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
name: Umbreon

dexEntry: Murkrow were feared as the alleged bearers of ill fortune. It shows strong interest in anything that sparkles. It will even try to steal rings from women.
name: Murkrow

dexEntry: It undertakes research every day to solve the mysteries of the world. However, it apparently forgets everything if the Shellder on its head comes off.
name: Slowking

dexEntry: A Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. It apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fear of foes as its nutrition.
name: Misdreavus

dexEntry: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient text characters. Although research is ongoing, it is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown.
name: Unown

dexEntry: Usually docile, a Wobbuffet strikes back ferociously if its black tail is attacked. It makes its lair in caves where it waits for nightfall.
name: Wobbuffet

dexEntry: A Girafarig is an herbivore--it eats grass and tree shoots. While it is eating, its tail makes chewing and swallowing motions as if it were also eating.
name: Girafarig

dexEntry: A Pineco hangs from a tree branch and waits for prey. While eating, if it is disturbed by someone shaking its tree, it falls on the ground and suddenly explodes.
name: Pineco

dexEntry: It keeps itself inside its steel shell. The shell is opened when it is catching prey, but it is so quick that the shell's inside cannot be seen.
name: Forretress

dexEntry: Its drill-tipped tail is used to burrow into the ground backwards. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
name: Dunsparce

dexEntry: It glides without making a single sound. It grasps the face of its foe using its hind and large front claws, then stabs with its poison barb.
name: Gligar

dexEntry: Steelix live even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth's core, reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
name: Steelix

dexEntry: Steelix live even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth's core, reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
name: Steelix

dexEntry: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, it sends smaller Pokémon scurrying in terror. The Snubbull does seem a little sad at making its foes flee.
name: Snubbull

dexEntry: It has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The huge fangs are heavy, causing it to tilt its head. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite.
name: Granbull

dexEntry: A Qwilfish uses the pressure of water it swallows to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming to be somewhat challenging.
name: Qwilfish

dexEntry: A Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. It flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.
name: Scizor

dexEntry: A Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. It flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.
name: Scizor

dexEntry: A Shuckle hides under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its shell while eating stored berries. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.
name: Shuckle

dexEntry: They gather in forests seeking the sweet sap of trees. It is completely clad in a steel-hard shell. It is proud of its horn, which it uses to fling foes.
name: Heracross

dexEntry: They gather in forests seeking the sweet sap of trees. It is completely clad in a steel-hard shell. It is proud of its horn, which it uses to fling foes.
name: Heracross

dexEntry: A Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. It seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.
name: Sneasel

dexEntry: It licks its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. A Teddiursa makes its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
name: Teddiursa

dexEntry: In forests, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where an Ursaring gathers food. It walks through its forest collecting food every day.
name: Ursaring

dexEntry: It is a species of Pokémon that lives in volcanic areas. If its body cools, its skin hardens and immobilizes it. To avoid that, it sleeps near magma.
name: Slugma

dexEntry: The shell on its back is made of hardened magma. Tens of thousands of years spent living in volcanic craters have turned Magcargo's bodies into magma.
name: Magcargo

dexEntry: It roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under dried grass. It occasionally roots out hot springs.
name: Swinub

dexEntry: A Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair for enduring freezing cold. It uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.
name: Piloswine

dexEntry: Corsola live in warm southern seas. If the sea becomes polluted, the beautiful coral stalks become discolored and crumble away in tatters.
name: Corsola

dexEntry: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. This Pokémon absorbs others’ life-force through its branches.
name: Corsola

dexEntry: A Remoraid uses its abdominal muscles to forcefully expel swallowed water, then shoot down flying prey. When evolution approaches, it travels down rivers.
name: Remoraid

dexEntry: It ensnares its foe with its suction- cupped tentacles before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, it spews ink to escape.
name: Octillery

dexEntry: It carries food bundled up in its tail. There was a famous explorer who managed to scale Mt. Everest thanks to a Delibird sharing its food.
name: Delibird

dexEntry: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the waves. It is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.
name: Mantine

dexEntry: A Pokémon that has a body and wings of steel. People in the past used feathers fallen from Skarmory to make swords and knives.
name: Skarmory

dexEntry: Houndour communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokémon's remarkable teamwork is simply unparalleled.
name: Houndour

dexEntry: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply back serves a leadership role. They choose their leader by fighting among themselves.
name: Houndoom

dexEntry: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply back serves a leadership role. They choose their leader by fighting among themselves.
name: Houndoom

dexEntry: It sleeps quietly, deep on the seafloor. When it comes up to the surface, it creates a huge whirlpool that can swallow even ships.
name: Kingdra

dexEntry: Phanpy's big ears serve as broad fans. When it becomes hot, it flaps the ears busily to cool down. Even the young are very strong.
name: Phanpy

dexEntry: A Donphan is so strong it can easily haul a dump truck. Its hide has toughened to a rock-hard state. An ordinary sort of attack won't even leave a scratch.
name: Donphan

dexEntry: It was created by humans using the power of science. It has been given artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.
name: Porygon2

dexEntry: Stantler's magnificent antlers were once traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction.
name: Stantler

dexEntry: A Smeargle marks its territory using a fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. About 5,000 different marks left by this Pokémon have been found.
name: Smeargle

dexEntry: Tyrogue become stressed out if they do not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the trainer must establish a regular training schedule.
name: Tyrogue

dexEntry: Its technique of kicking while spinning is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense. Hitmontop travel faster spinning than they do walking.
name: Hitmontop

dexEntry: It actively runs about, but also falls often. Whenever it falls, it will check its reflection on a lake's surface to make sure its face hasn't become dirty.
name: Smoochum

dexEntry: If it touches metal and discharges the electricity it has stored in its body, an Elekid begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
name: Elekid

dexEntry: If a Magby is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
name: Magby

dexEntry: It gives over five gallons of milk daily. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can't drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.
name: Miltank

dexEntry: If it senses sadness with its fluffy fur, a Blissey will rush over to the sad person, however far away, to share an egg of happiness that brings a smile to any face.
name: Blissey

dexEntry: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. Its roars send shock waves shuddering through the air and ground as if lightning bolts were crashing down.
name: Raikou

dexEntry: Entei embodies the passion of magma. It is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It blasts fire that consumes all that it touches.
name: Entei

dexEntry: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gliding elegance. It has the power to purify dirty water.
name: Suicune

dexEntry: A Larvitar is born deep under the ground. It must eat its way through the soil above and reach the surface for it to see its parents' faces.
name: Larvitar

dexEntry: A Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it ejects under compression to propel itself like a jet. Its body can withstand a collision with solid steel.
name: Pupitar

dexEntry: A Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. It roams in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
name: Tyranitar

dexEntry: A Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. It roams in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
name: Tyranitar

dexEntry: Lugia is so powerful even a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart houses. As a result, it chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
name: Lugia

dexEntry: Its feathers--which glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light--are thought to bring joy. It is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
name: Ho-Oh

dexEntry: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
name: Celebi

dexEntry: It makes its nest in a giant tree in the forest. It ferociously guards against anything nearing its territory. It is said to be the protector of the forest's trees.
name: Treecko

dexEntry: Leaves grow out of this Pokémon's body. They help obscure a Grovyle from the eyes of its enemies while it is in a thickly overgrown forest.
name: Grovyle

dexEntry: In the jungle, its power is without equal. This Pokémon carefully grows trees and plants. It regulates its body temperature by basking in sunlight.
name: Sceptile

dexEntry: In the jungle, its power is without equal. This Pokémon carefully grows trees and plants. It regulates its body temperature by basking in sunlight.
name: Sceptile

dexEntry: If attacked, it strikes back by spitting balls of fire it forms in its stomach. A Torchic dislikes darkness because it can't see its surroundings.
name: Torchic

dexEntry: It lashes out with 10 kicks per second. Its strong fighting instinct compels it to keep up its offensive until the opponent gives up.
name: Combusken

dexEntry: It learns martial arts that use punches and kicks. Every several years, its old feathers burn off, and new, supple feathers grow back in their place.
name: Blaziken

dexEntry: It learns martial arts that use punches and kicks. Every several years, its old feathers burn off, and new, supple feathers grow back in their place.
name: Blaziken

dexEntry: On land, it can powerfully lift large boulders by planting its four feet and heaving. It sleeps by burying itself in soil at the water's edge.
name: Mudkip

dexEntry: Its toughened hind legs enable it to stand upright. Because it weakens if its skin dries out, it replenishes fluids by playing in mud.
name: Marshtomp

dexEntry: If it senses the approach of a storm and a tidal wave, it protects its seaside nest by piling up boulders. It swims as fast as a jet ski.
name: Swampert

dexEntry: If it senses the approach of a storm and a tidal wave, it protects its seaside nest by piling up boulders. It swims as fast as a jet ski.
name: Swampert

dexEntry: It savagely threatens foes with bared fangs. It chases after fleeing targets tenaciously. It turns tail and runs, however, if the foe strikes back.
name: Poochyena

dexEntry: In the wild, Mightyena live in a pack. They never defy their leader's orders. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.
name: Mightyena

dexEntry: Rubbing its nose against the ground, it always wanders about back and forth in search of something. It is distinguished by the zigzag footprints it leaves.
name: Zigzagoon

dexEntry: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.
name: Zigzagoon

dexEntry: It is exceedingly fast if it only has to run in a straight line. When it spots pond- dwelling prey underwater, it quickly leaps in and catches it with its sharp claws.
name: Linoone

dexEntry: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.
name: Linoone

dexEntry: It sticks to tree branches and eats leaves. The thread it spits from its mouth, which becomes gooey when it touches air, slows the movement of its foes.
name: Wurmple

dexEntry: It prepares for evolution using the energy it stored while it was a Wurmple. It keeps watch over the surroundings with its two eyes.
name: Silcoon

dexEntry: Its colorfully patterned wings are its most prominent feature. It flies through flower-covered fields collecting pollen. It attacks ferociously when angered.
name: Beautifly

dexEntry: To avoid detection by its enemies, it hides motionlessly beneath large leaves and in the gaps of branches. It also attaches dead leaves to its body for camouflage.
name: Cascoon

dexEntry: It is a nocturnal Pokémon that flies from fields and mountains to the attraction of streetlights at night. It looses highly toxic powder from its wings.
name: Dustox

dexEntry: This Pokémon lives in ponds with clean water. It is known to ferry small Pokémon across ponds by carrying them on the broad leaf on its head.
name: Lotad

dexEntry: In the evening, it takes great delight in popping out of rivers and startling people. It feeds on aquatic moss that grows on rocks in the riverbed.
name: Lombre

dexEntry: When it hears festive music, all the cells in its body become stimulated, and it begins moving in rhythm. It does not quail even when it faces a tough opponent.
name: Ludicolo

dexEntry: It hangs off branches and absorbs nutrients. When it finishes eating, its body becomes so heavy that it drops to the ground with a thump.
name: Seedot

dexEntry: A forest-dwelling Pokémon that is skilled at climbing trees. Its long and pointed nose is its weak point. It loses power if the nose is gripped.
name: Nuzleaf

dexEntry: It is said to arrive on chilly, wintry winds. Feared from long ago as the guardian of forests, this Pokémon lives in a deep forest where people do not venture.
name: Shiftry

dexEntry: Although it is small, it is very courageous. It will take on a larger Skarmory on an equal footing. However, its will weakens if it becomes hungry.
name: Taillow

dexEntry: A Swellow dives upon prey from far above. It never misses its targets. It takes to the skies in search of lands with a warm climate.
name: Swellow

dexEntry: It makes its nest on a sheer cliff at the edge of the sea. It has trouble keeping its wings flapping in flight. Instead, it soars on updrafts.
name: Wingull

dexEntry: It skims the tops of waves as it flies. When it spots prey, it uses its large beak to scoop up the victim with water. It protects its eggs in its beak.
name: Pelipper

dexEntry: A Ralts has the power to sense the emotions of people and Pokémon with the horns on its head. It takes cover if it senses any hostility.
name: Ralts

dexEntry: A Kirlia has the psychic power to create a rip in the dimensions and see into the future. It is said to dance with pleasure on sunny mornings.
name: Kirlia

dexEntry: It apparently does not feel the pull of gravity because it supports itself with psychic power. It will give its life to protect its trainer.
name: Gardevoir

dexEntry: It apparently does not feel the pull of gravity because it supports itself with psychic power. It will give its life to protect its trainer.

dexEntry: It has a compassionate personality, but when angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its breath.
name: Drampa

dexEntry: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
name: Dhelmise

dexEntry: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where it lives.
name: Jangmo-o

dexEntry: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches can tear its opponents to shreds.
name: Hakamo-o

dexEntry: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling its scales. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
name: Kommo-o

dexEntry: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning.
name: Tapu Koko

dexEntry: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
name: Tapu Lele

dexEntry: This guardian deity of Ula'ula is lazy. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then hits them with its horns.
name: Tapu Bulu

dexEntry: This guardian deity of Poni controls water. They say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
name: Tapu Fini

dexEntry: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowsly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
name: Cosmog

dexEntry: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of stars.
name: Cosmoem

dexEntry: At activation of its third eye, it departs for another world where it is said to live.
name: Solgaleo

dexEntry: When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world where it is said to live.
name: Lunala

dexEntry: People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Nihilego

dexEntry: People saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Buzzwole

dexEntry: It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses uncleanness in this world. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Pheromosa

dexEntry: Because it raided a power plant, people think it energizes itself with electricity. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Xurkitree

dexEntry: People have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Celesteela

dexEntry: People observed it cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Kartana

dexEntry: People claim to have seen it gobble mountains and swallow whole building. It is an Ultra Beast.
name: Guzzlord

dexEntry: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
name: Necrozma

dexEntry: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
name: Necrozma

dexEntry: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
name: Necrozma

dexEntry: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
name: Necrozma

dexEntry: This artificial Pokémon, more than 500 years old, can understand human speech but cannot speak itself.
name: Magearna

dexEntry: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before human, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
name: Marshadow

dexEntry: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
name: Poipole

dexEntry: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
name: Naganadel

dexEntry: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
name: Stakataka

dexEntry: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
name: Blacephalon

dexEntry: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
name: Zeraora

dexEntry: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
name: Meltan

dexEntry: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
name: Melmetal

dexEntry: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
name: Grookey

dexEntry: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
name: Thwackey

dexEntry: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
name: Rillaboom

dexEntry: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
name: Scorbunny

dexEntry: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
name: Raboot

dexEntry: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
name: Cinderace

dexEntry: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
name: Sobble

dexEntry: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
name: Drizzile

dexEntry: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
name: Inteleon

dexEntry: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
name: Skwovet

dexEntry: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
name: Greedent

dexEntry: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
name: Rookidee

dexEntry: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
name: Corvisquire

dexEntry: This Pokémon regins supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
name: Corviknight

dexEntry: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
name: Blipbug

dexEntry: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
name: Dottler

dexEntry: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
name: Orbeetle

dexEntry: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
name: Nickit

dexEntry: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
name: Thievul

dexEntry: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
name: Gossifleur

dexEntry: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
name: Eldegoss

dexEntry: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
name: Wooloo

dexEntry: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
name: Dubwool

dexEntry: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
name: Chewtle

dexEntry: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
name: Drednaw

dexEntry: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
name: Yamper

dexEntry: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
name: Boltund

dexEntry: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
name: Rolycoly

dexEntry: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
name: Carkol

dexEntry: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
name: Coalossal

dexEntry: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
name: Applin

dexEntry: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
name: Flapple

dexEntry: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
name: Appletun

dexEntry: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
name: Silicobra

dexEntry: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
name: Sandaconda

dexEntry: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
name: Cramorant

dexEntry: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.
name: Cramorant

dexEntry: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodge in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn't really bothered.
name: Cramorant

dexEntry: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
name: Arrokuda

dexEntry: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
name: Barraskewda

dexEntry: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
name: Toxel

dexEntry: When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
name: Toxtricity

dexEntry: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.
name: Toxtricity

dexEntry: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
name: Sizzlipede

dexEntry: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
name: Centiskorch

dexEntry: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
name: Clobbopus

dexEntry: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
name: Grapploct

dexEntry: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
name: Sinistea

dexEntry: It absorbs the life-force of those who drink it. It waits patiently, but opportunities are fleeting—it tastes so bad that it gets spat out immediately.
name: Sinistea

dexEntry: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
name: Polteageist

dexEntry: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
name: Polteageist

dexEntry: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
name: Hatenna

dexEntry: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
name: Hattrem

dexEntry: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
name: Hatterene

dexEntry: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
name: Impidimp

dexEntry: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, its trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
name: Morgrem

dexEntry: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
name: Grimmsnarl

dexEntry: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
name: Obstagoon

dexEntry: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
name: Perrserker

dexEntry: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
name: Cursola

dexEntry: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
name: Sirfetch'd

dexEntry: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
name: Mr. Rime

dexEntry: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
name: Runerigus

dexEntry: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
name: Milcery

dexEntry: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
name: Alcremie

dexEntry: The moment it evolved, it took a mixed flavor. This is because of the way its cells spntaneously shifted during evolution.
name: Alcremie

dexEntry: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.
name: Falinks

dexEntry: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
name: Pincurchin

dexEntry: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
name: Snom

dexEntry: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
name: Frosmoth

dexEntry: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
name: Stonjourner

dexEntry: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
name: Eiscue

dexEntry: The ice covering this Pokémon face has shattered, revealing a slightly worries expression that many people are enamored with.
name: Eiscue

dexEntry: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
name: Indeedee

dexEntry: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
name: Indeedee

dexEntry: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
name: Morpeko

dexEntry: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
name: Morpeko

dexEntry: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
name: Cufant

dexEntry: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
name: Copperajah

dexEntry: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
name: Dracozolt

dexEntry: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
name: Arctozolt

dexEntry: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
name: Dracovish

dexEntry: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
name: Arctovish

dexEntry: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
name: Duraludon

dexEntry: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
name: Dreepy

dexEntry: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
name: Drakloak

dexEntry: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
name: Dragapult

dexEntry: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
name: Zacian

dexEntry: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.
name: Zacian

dexEntry: In times past, it worked together with a kign of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
name: Zamazenta

dexEntry: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all
name: Zamazenta

dexEntry: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
name: Eternatus

dexEntry: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
name: Kubfu

dexEntry: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
name: Urshifu

dexEntry: All it takes is a glare from this Pokémon to take the lives of those with evil in their hearts — or so they say.
name: Urshifu

dexEntry: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
name: Zarude
